extendedIngredients.name: black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: boneless chicken breast
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound boneless chicken breast, cut into large 1-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: yellow bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup diced bell pepper (red and yellow), ¼-inch dice

extendedIngredients.name: yellow onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup diced yellow onion, ¼-inch dice

extendedIngredients.name: zucchini
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups diced zucchini, quartered and cut into ¼-inch thick slices

recipes.title: Easy One Pot Chicken Cacciatore Pasta

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi
productMatches.description: Complexity and intensity define this Chardonnay. The nose is full of citrus, green apple and pear with floral overtones. The flavors are rich on entry with lively fruit in the mid palate and a long fruity, warm finish.

recipes.instructions: In a medium sized bowl combine cut chicken with 1 teaspoon salt and  teaspoon pepper.Heat a large 12-inch skillet with high sides over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add seasoned chicken pieces to the hot oil, evenly spacing them in the pan. Cook about 2 minutes on each side, 4 minutes total, until lightly browned. The chicken will continue cooking with pasta so just sear the surface. Transfer to a clean plate and set aside.Turn heat to medium and add 1 tablespoon of oil to the pan. Add garlic and onion and saute for 1 minute, constantly stirring until onions are tender. Turn medium high and add mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Add bell pepper, zucchini, and red pepper flakes. Stir and cook for 2 minutes. Add cooked chicken, uncooked rotini pasta and 3 cups or water to the pan. Turn heat up to high. Set the timer to 10 minutes and cook on high, stirring occasionally, until most of the water is absorbed and pasta is tender. Time may vary depending on the stove. Turn heat down to low.Stir in marinara sauce and oregano, cook until warmed, about 2 minutes. Season pasta with more salt and pepper as needed.Serve pasta hot and garnish with parsley and basil. Enjoy!

steps.step: In a medium sized bowl combine cut chicken with 1 teaspoon salt and  teaspoon pepper.
Heat a large 12-inch skillet with high sides over medium-high heat.

Add seasoned chicken pieces to the hot oil, evenly spacing them in the pan. Cook about 2 minutes on each side, 4 minutes total, until lightly browned. The chicken will continue cooking with pasta so just sear the surface.
Transfer to a clean plate and set aside.Turn heat to medium and add 1 tablespoon of oil to the pan.
Add garlic and onion and saute for 1 minute, constantly stirring until onions are tender. Turn medium high and add mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes.
Add bell pepper, zucchini, and red pepper flakes. Stir and cook for 2 minutes.

Add cooked chicken, uncooked rotini pasta and 3 cups or water to the pan. Turn heat up to high. Set the timer to 10 minutes and cook on high, stirring occasionally, until most of the water is absorbed and pasta is tender. Time may vary depending on the stove. Turn heat down to low.Stir in marinara sauce and oregano, cook until warmed, about 2 minutes. Season pasta with more salt and pepper as needed.
Serve pasta hot and garnish with parsley and basil. Enjoy!
